formal governance processes.reasoning: Formal governance processes refer to structured methods used by platform firms to monitor and manage transactions, indicating a specific approach to governance in the study.
passages: This paper examines certain formal (monitoring) and informal (procedural fairness) governance processes that platform firms can leverage to manage platform participants.

informal governance processes.reasoning: Informal governance processes involve less structured methods that focus on procedural fairness, representing a specific approach used by the platform firms in the research.
passages: This paper examines certain formal (monitoring) and informal (procedural fairness) governance processes that platform firms can leverage to manage platform participants.

hypothesis testing.reasoning: Hypothesis testing is a methodological approach used to assess the impact of governance processes on seller performance, forming a key part of the research methodology.
passages: We hypothesize the impact of these processes on sellers' performance vis-a-vis the platform's buyers.
